conclusion: Determine the electric force experienced by the small ball at point B due to charges at points M and N.
Calculate the electric field at point B.
Charges at points M and N are +Q and -Q, forming an equilateral triangle with side length L.
Distance from point B to each of the charges M and N is the height of the equilateral triangle, L sin 60Â° = (sqrt(3)/2) L.
Electric field due to charge +Q at point B is E+ = 4kQ/3L^2.
Electric field due to charge -Q at point B is E- = -4kQ/3L^2.
Electric field due to charge +Q is directed from M to B.
Electric field due to charge -Q is directed from B to N.
Electric fields due to charges +Q and -Q are perpendicular to each other.
Magnitude of resultant electric field at point B is E_total = 4sqrt(2)kQ/3L^2.
Electric force on the small ball is F = 4sqrt(2)kqQ/3L^2.
Magnitude of electric force experienced by the small ball at point B is 4sqrt(2)kqQ/3L^2.
